title: D. Jordan landing on Pelicans roster, agent says
content: Free agent center DeAndre Jordan is signing a one-year, $3.6 million deal with the Pelicans, his agent told ESPN.

title: Vitello: 'Selfish' but 'right' call to manage Giants
content: Tony Vitello told reporters he leaned on "anyone and everyone" before making the decision to leave the Tennessee baseball program and manage the Giants.

title: Source: Bettors allegedly given LeBron injury info
content: Former player Damon Jones was arrested amid charges he allegedly disclosed injury info about Lakers star LeBron James, a source told ESPN, to facilitate illegal betting.

title: Dolphins' Hill undecided on retirement after injury
content: Dolphins star receiver Tyreek Hill hasn't yet decided if he's done playing football after suffering a season-ending knee injury against the Jets on Sept 29.

title: Dubs survive Gordon's 50 behind Curry in clutch
content: Stephen Curry scored 42 points, including a tying 34-footer near the end of regulation, and the Warriors survived a 50-point explosion from Aaron Gordon to win 137-131.

title: McCarthy nears return as Wentz fights pain in loss
content: Vikings coach Kevin O'Connell reaffirmed his commitment to getting J.J. McCarthy back on the field as soon as possible, saying he believes his return is "right around the corner."

title: Barca's Yamal makes dig at Madrid before Cl√°sico
content: Barcelona forward Lamine Yamal has stirred the pot ahead of Sunday's El Cl√°sico by claiming Real Madrid "rob and complain."

content: The crowd theme for Oregon's game against Wisconsin this week is tie-dye, and the Ducks are incorporating a number of Grateful Dead motifs into their uniforms.

title: Aaron Rodgers at home with Steelers, at peace with Packers
content: There's a fire still burning inside the QB who's happy in Pittsburgh but respectful of his time in Green Bay.

content: Not since Messi vs. Ronaldo has the Barcelona-Real Madrid rivalry given us a matchup like Yamal vs. Mbappe. So, which superstar would you rather have?

title: Madrid vs. Bar√ßa head-to-head, form, key clashes, predictions, odds
content: When Real Madrid and Barcelona face off, there's nothing bigger happening anywhere in the soccer world.

content: So far, every team in the NFC East except the Eagles has played three division games. Here's how they stack up.

content: DeSean Jackson and Matt Dodge relive a 15-year-old shank and a walk-off return that fans will never forget.

content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: UFC 321: Inside Tom Aspinall's unique heavyweight strategy
content: Tom Aspinall and his father and coach, Andy, have developed a strategy that has yet to be truly tested.

title: Piastri: Norris & I have 'clean slate' in Mexico
content: Oscar Piastri has confirmed that he and McLaren teammate Lando Norris are starting from a "clean slate" at the Mexican Grand Prix after the Australian took responsibility for their collision at the U.S. Grand Prix.

title: Norris laughs off Red Bull sticky tape 'side quests'
content: Lando Norris has laughed off Red Bull's attempts to remove tape from the pit wall that he was using as a visual aid to ensure his car was not too far forward in its grid slot.

title: Amorim's record has a missing middle: Can Man United solve the riddle of midtable sides?
content: Ruben Amorim and Manchester United are flying high after beating Liverpool, but it's not the Big Six they should be most worried about.

title: Soccer's longest away trips: Journeys that clock up thousands of miles, cross continents
content: Truro is preparing to make the longest round trip for a professional league match in English soccer history.

title: Round 1 preview, predictions: Can anyone stop Philly?
content: Now that the Wild Card games are over with, the MLS postseason moves into the best-of-three Round 1. Who will move on? ESPN makes its predictions.

title: 'I cannot recall that meeting': How Giannis and the Bucks managed an awkward offseason
content: For the first time in Antetokounmpo's prime, he's signaled interest in playing elsewhere -- and provided the team a deadline for when he might make a decision. Here's what might come next.

title: Amir Abdur-Rahim's legacy lives on 1 year after his sudden passing
content: Those closest to the late South Florida coach remember him one year after his death shocked college basketball.

title: Top 100 men's NCAA basketball players going into 2025-26
content: From seniors who have taken the national stage before to freshmen entering the spotlight, here is our 1-100.

title: Bilas' 2025 preseason All-America teams
content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: Last-minute pickups: Bucs duo of Tez Johnson, Cade Otton among top Week 8 options
content: If this heavy bye week or injuries have you seeking lineup help, we have available options to consider.

title: 'Police, political pressure': Satara doc's suicide case gets murky; kin makes big claim
content: A woman doctor in Maharashtra's Satara district died by suicide, accusing PSI Gopal Badane and another man, Bankar, of rape and harassment. The accused PSI has been suspended and arrested, with authorities launching a thorough investigation into the grave allegations. The chief minister has ordered strict action against all involved.

title: Summit to sanctions: Trump's oil shock - will Putin end Ukraine war?
content: In a significant shift, the US has imposed stringent sanctions on Russia's top oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, targeting the financial backbone of its war in Ukraine. This move, aimed at crippling Moscow's revenue streams, has already impacted global oil markets and prompted major buyers like China and India to reassess their purchases.

title: 'He's got two ducks' - Ex-Aus captain predicts Kohli's performance in Sydney
content: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke backed Virat Kohli to be the leading run-scorer and Josh Hazlewood to take the most wickets in the final ODI against India. Clarke also predicted an Indian victory, hoping for a morale-boosting win for the hosts ahead of the T20I series.

title: Microsoft‚Äôs No to Erotica: Distances tech giant from OpenAI; Company AI CEO calls it dangerous
content: Microsoft's AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, has declared the company will not develop AI services for simulated erotica, deeming it a 'dangerous' path. This stance distances Microsoft from OpenAI's recent ChatGPT offering. Suleyman fears such AI could foster division and unhealthy human-machine attachments, highlighting a growing divergence between the tech giants.

title: 'Check for poisoning': Mystery deepens in ex-Punjab DGP's son's death; diary missing
content: Investigators are searching for a diary containing a dying declaration in the mysterious death of Aqil Akhtar, son of former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa. The FIR names Mustafa, his wife, daughter, and daughter-in-law. The post-mortem was inconclusive, with viscera analysis awaited. The family is expected back for questioning soon.

title: 'Very near': Govt official's big update on India-US trade pact; 'no new issues acting as hurdle'
content: India and the United States are close to finalizing a trade deal. Officials report significant progress with most issues resolved. Discussions are proceeding smoothly, indicating a resolution is imminent.

title: Six Sixes! Flintoff admits he crossed the line with Yuvraj
content: Andrew Flintoff confessed to provoking Yuvraj Singh before the infamous 2007 T20 World Cup over where Stuart Broad conceded six sixes. Flintoff admitted he "crossed the line" with his banter, which fueled Yuvraj's historic onslaught. Yuvraj, acknowledging the legend, responded with a laughing emoji to Flintoff's candid admission, highlighting the competitive spirit behind the unforgettable cricketing moment.

title: Elon Musk makes fun of ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, Perplexity CEO 'joins the fun'
content: Elon Musk playfully critiqued AI firms like OpenAI and Anthropic, sparking a witty exchange with Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas. This followed research revealing AI models value lives differently across nationalities, with some models showing a significant bias. Musk's humorous take on company names added a lighthearted touch to the discussion on AI's complex value systems.

title: Trump sanctions to hit India: Will New Delhi shift from Russian to US oil? Analysts weigh in
content: New US sanctions on Russian oil giants Rosneft and Lukoil are prompting Indian refiners to seek more crude from the Middle East, Latin America, and the US. While direct Russian imports may dip, supplies are expected to continue via intermediaries. This shift could increase India's import bill, with Reliance Industries facing the biggest adjustment.

title: Kohli retirement rumours: Ex-IND cricketer clarifies; earlier post sparks debate
content: Speculation about Virat Kohli's ODI retirement arose after a cryptic tweet from Parthiv Patel and Kohli's recent dismissals. However, the former India wicketkeeper-batter clarified that Kohli is not retiring from ODIs. The star batter now aims to perform well in the final ODI in Sydney after a challenging series Down Under.

title: Gold reserves vs dollar assets: Why is RBI buying gold & reducing investments in US treasury securities - top points to know
content: India's central bank is strategically shifting its foreign exchange reserves, favoring gold over dollar-based assets. The RBI has significantly increased its gold holdings, now exceeding 880 tonnes, while simultaneously reducing its investments in US Treasury Securities to a seven-month low.

title: What OpenAI didn't tell users openly about its ChatGPT Atlas browser: It is built on ...
content: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Atlas browser, touted as a revolutionary AI-powered navigation tool, has been revealed to be built on Google's Chromium, the same open-source technology underpinning Chrome and other browsers. Despite claims of challenging Chrome's dominance, Atlas integrates AI features like ChatGPT sidebars and "browser memories" onto a familiar foundation. This move places Atlas alongside other AI-enhanced browsers like Perplexity's Comet, all leveraging Google's existing browser architecture rather than introducing entirely new technology.

title: Emman Atienza: How did the TikTok star, daughter of Kuya Kim Atienza die at 19
content: TikTok creator Emman Atienza, 19, daughter of TV host Kim Atienza, passed away by suicide in Los Angeles on October 22. Known for her honest discussions on self-love and mental health, her passing has deeply affected her family, friends, and thousands of young followers who found solace in her online presence.

title: Will Bihar say 'Tejashwi Bhava'? MGB's latest poll gamble explained
content: The Mahagathbandhan has named 36-year-old Tejashwi Yadav as its chief ministerial face for the Bihar elections, aiming to consolidate its M-Y base and present a youth-driven alternative. This move contrasts with the NDA's aging leadership and indecision, but risks alienating other OBC groups and faces the 'Jungle Raj' narrative.

title: Another low! Naqvi moves Asia Cup trophy out of ACC HQ; where is it now?
content: The Asia Cup trophy is now in Mohsin Naqvi's custody in Abu Dhabi following India's refusal to accept it from him due to cross-border tensions.  Despite BCCI's request, Naqvi insists an Indian player must attend a ceremony to receive the trophy, leaving its handover unresolved after an ACC meeting.

title: 'Cheated & got caught!' Trump targets Canada again - the 'Reagan ad' that sparked rant
content: President Trump abruptly canceled trade negotiations with Canada, accusing Ottawa of fraudulent interference in U.S. judicial matters. He alleged an Ontario advertisement misrepresenting Ronald Reagan's views on tariffs was an illegal attempt to influence the Supreme Court. This action escalates existing trade tensions between the two nations.

title: What are carbide guns? Diwali celebrations leave 300 injured in MP; 30 facing blindness
content: Diwali, typically a time of joy and lights, cast a shadow this year as approximately 300 individuals, many of whom were young children, found themselves grappling with eye injuries due to the reckless use of 'carbide guns' that function as agri-cannons. Several victims sustained severe alkali burns, with alarming prospects of vision impairment.

title: One Big Beautiful Bill: How Trump‚Äôs mega-legislation is reshaping education, social policy
content: The ‚ÄúOne Big Beautiful Bill‚Äù is reshaping education and social programs across the U.S., affecting everything from K-12 schools to college and family support. It brings federal school vouchers, changes to Medicaid and SNAP, a slight boost to the Child Tax Credit, and stricter student loan rules. While it promises more choice, it also raises concerns about fairness and the impact on families and schools.

title: 'Itne murder karo ki SP ka transfer ho jaaye': Inside Bihar‚Äôs ‚ÄòSigma Gang‚Äô
content: The Ranjan Pathak syndicate acted as judge, jury, and executioner. An intercepted call led to a multi-state search for Ranjan and his gang, Sigma & Company. A brazen extortion call ended the manhunt. Pathak sent press releases after murders, detailing reasons and claiming justice. His Instagram posts showed defiance. Born into a humble family, Pathak's criminal rise was quick.

title: Emman Atienza net worth in 2025: Inside luxury life of Kuya Kim Atienza‚Äôs 19-yr-old daughter
content: Emman Atienza, a 19-year-old TikTok star and daughter of Kim Atienza, died on October 22, 2025. She was known for her honest discussions on mental health. Her passing has deeply affected fans and the digital community. Emman Atienza's family confirmed her death, remembering her as a bright and creative individual.

title: From Ranji to India's Adman: Piyush Pandey's cricket career before iconic ads
content: Piyush Pandey, renowned as 'India's Adman,' passed away at 70, leaving a legacy in advertising after a brief stint as a first-class cricketer. He transformed Indian advertising with iconic campaigns for brands like Cadbury and Fevicol, making Hindi mainstream and infusing humor. His passing was mourned by national leaders and industrialists.

title: Trump sanctions impact: Reliance buys millions of barrels of crude from Middle East, US
content: Reliance Industries is diversifying its crude oil sources, shifting away from Russian supplies following US sanctions on major Russian firms. The Indian giant has secured millions of barrels from the Middle East and the US, with shipments expected in December and January. This move signals a significant change in India's energy procurement strategy amidst global geopolitical shifts.

title: Watch: Louvre museum thieves‚Äô slow getaway with France‚Äôs crown jewels
content: Two thieves made off with an estimated ‚Ç¨88 million in French crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in a daring daylight heist. Captured on video, the men used a furniture lift and scooters to escape after smashing display cases and seizing eight historic pieces.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Estonian who juggled two chess tournaments and formats - and won the title!
content: Estonian chess talent Mai Narva achieved a remarkable feat by winning the Global Chess League (GCL) Contenders Knockout while simultaneously competing in the European Team Chess Championship. The 26-year-old International Master (IM) juggled over-the-board classical games with online rapid matches, securing the Women's Contenders champion title and earning the GCL 2025 Ambassador role.

title: 'Thamma' & 'Stree 2' composer arrested over sexual harassment allegations; released on bail
content: Bollywood composer Sachin Sanghvi has been arrested following a sexual harassment complaint. A 29-year-old woman alleged assault after Sanghvi contacted her on Instagram. The musician was taken into custody but has since been released on bail. His lawyer stated the allegations are baseless. Sanghvi is known for his work with the duo Sachin-Jigar.

title: ‚ÄòShattered windows to escape‚Äô: Survivors recount terrifying bus blaze; 20 dead
content: A private bus travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru caught fire near Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, after colliding with a bike. The incident, which occurred around 3 AM, resulted in at least 20 fatalities as passengers struggled to escape due to locked doors and a lack of safety equipment.

title: In or out, every breath you take is poison: Fireworks turn Delhi homes into toxic chambers
content: A Delhi Technological University study revealed that indoor air quality plummets during Diwali, with ultrafine particles from fireworks, cooking, and rituals becoming significantly more concentrated than outdoor pollution. These microscopic particles, exceeding PM2.5 by 25 times, penetrate deep into the body, posing serious long-term respiratory and cardiac health risks, especially for vulnerable populations.

title: America‚Äôs fifth president‚Äôs daughter Eliza Monroe Hay laid to rest after 200 years
content: Eliza Monroe Hay, daughter of President James Monroe, will be laid to rest in Virginia nearly two centuries after her death in France. Her remains, previously in an unmarked grave, are being repatriated following research that revealed her financial struggles and attempts to return home. This brings closure to a long period of neglect for the eldest presidential daughter.

title: Hockey: Pak withdraw from Junior World Cup in India; demand neutral venue
content: Pakistan has withdrawn from the 2025 Junior Hockey World Cup in India, citing deteriorating sporting ties following recent terror attacks and India's new policy restricting bilateral contests. This marks their second withdrawal from an Indian tournament, with the Pakistan Hockey Federation seeking a neutral venue to avoid missing major events.

title: 'Raped repeatedly': Woman doc dies by suicide; writes names of 2 cops on palm
content: A woman doctor in Maharashtra's Satara district died by suicide, leaving a note accusing two police personnel of rape and mental harassment. The doctor was found hanging in a hotel room, and authorities have registered a case and are investigating the allegations. The Maharashtra Women's Commission has ordered strict action against the accused.

title: 'I'll show you what badtameezi is': Flyer threatened mid-air over not speaking Marathi
content: A viral video shows a mid-air confrontation on an Air India flight where a passenger was allegedly threatened for not speaking Marathi. The incident occurred on October 23, with a co-passenger demanding the content creator speak Marathi as he was traveling to Mumbai. The situation escalated when the passenger refused and was reportedly threatened.

title: Oh crab! Annual migration of shellfish begins; Australian island turns red
content: Christmas Island's annual red crab migration has commenced, with up to 100 million crabs journeying to the ocean for breeding after seasonal rains. Roads turn red as the crabs traverse the landscape, requiring locals to adapt their routines and assist the crustaceans. This unique spectacle is a privilege for residents, culminating in egg release around November 14-15.

title: Explained: What is the NBA gambling case? Who has been arrested? Is LeBron James involved?
content: NBA figures Chauncey Billups and Terry Rozier were arrested in New York for alleged involvement in schemes to rig sports bets and poker games. Prosecutors claim millions were defrauded through cheating and insider NBA information, with connections to Mafia families. Both athletes face money laundering and wire fraud conspiracy charges.

title: Family of Punjab youth held in US truck crash case in shock; say ‚Äòhe is God-fearing'
content: A 21-year-old Sikh truck driver from Punjab, Jashanpreet Singh, faces charges after an eight-vehicle crash in California killed three and injured four. His family in India is in shock, pleading for his release and emphasizing his clean record. Community leaders are seeking government intervention for fair treatment and leniency.

title: 'Won't sign trade deal in hurry': India's clear message to US; sets strict riders
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said that no trade deals will be rushed, rejecting restrictive conditions from partner nations. This comes amid ongoing EU-India free trade talks and discussions with the US. Goyal's remarks follow pressure from the US and EU regarding India's Russian crude oil purchases, with the US imposing tariffs.

title: Gurgaon horror: Friend proposes, woman says no; he shoots her
content: A 33-year-old man, Vipin, shot a 25-year-old woman, Shivangi, in Gurgaon after she rejected his marriage proposal and ceased communication. The incident occurred as Shivangi was leaving for work. Vipin, who had known Shivangi for two years, confronted her, leading to an argument and the shooting. He was apprehended at the scene.

title: Upset over breakup, man stabs ex-girlfriend, then slits his own throat
content: A 24-year-old man, reportedly distraught over a breakup, fatally stabbed his girlfriend before taking his own life in a public attack near Chinchpokli station. The woman, Manisha Yadav, is in critical condition after being pursued into a nursing home and repeatedly attacked. Police are investigating the incident, which stemmed from a suspected relationship dispute.

title: Bihar elections: Is it official? Nitish Kumar to be NDA's CM face ‚Äî What PM Modi said
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Bihar election campaign in Samastipur, asserting the NDA's return to power and criticizing the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan. He highlighted the state's progress since 2005 and urged voters to reject "jungle raj" in favor of good governance, symbolically contrasting mobile flashlights with the RJD's lantern symbol.

title: After India, Afghanistan may restrict river water supply to Pakistan; Taliban to construct dam
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government is constructing a dam on the Kunar River, aiming to restrict water flow to Pakistan amidst escalating border tensions. This development follows India's decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty after a terror attack. The dam project intensifies regional water disputes, impacting vital resources for both nations.

title: PSL team owner tears up legal notice; mocks Pakistan board on camera
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen defiantly responded to a PCB legal notice, which threatened a lifetime ban for criticizing PSL management. Tareen, who has raised concerns about communication and transparency, tore up the notice in a video, questioning the PCB's competence.  This highlights ongoing franchise owner tensions and accountability issues within Pakistan cricket.

title: First IIT campus in Nigeria: How India is expanding global education footprint - details here
content: Nigeria is set to host the first Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) campus in West Africa, a move aligning with India's National Education Policy 2020. The IIT Nigeria campus, located at the Federal Government Academy in Suleja, will offer undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in engineering and technology, with the first students expected in 2026.

title: Andhra bus inferno: Vehicle had 16 challans for traffic violations
content: A Kaveri Travels bus, which tragically caught fire killing at least 20 passengers, had a history of 16 traffic violations in Telangana despite holding valid fitness and insurance certificates. The Scania bus, owned by Vemuri Kaveri Travels, reportedly ignited after colliding with a motorcycle, leading to a fuel tank explosion.

title: Fedora-hat detective investigating Louvre heist is internet‚Äôs latest obsession
content: Thieves stole 88 million euros in historic jewelry from the Louvre on Sunday, prompting the director's resignation and exposing security flaws. Online, the heist has been meme-ified, with a viral image of a stylish man sparking speculation about a fedora-wearing detective. Investigators have found DNA traces and new footage of the gang, who used power tools and escaped on scooters.

title: ISIS-inspired module busted: Two suspected terrorists arrested
content: Delhi's security forces have successfully thwarted a dangerous plot as they apprehended two suspects tied to an ISIS-inspired network. The operatives were reportedly gearing up for a devastating IED attack. A thorough search led to the recovery of various arms and ammunition, as officials maintain a comprehensive investigation to dismantle the entire operation and trace any foreign affiliations.

title: Kolkata: 15-year-old OPD patient sexually abused at SSKM Hospital washroom
content: A 15-year-old girl was molested in a SSKM Hospital washroom by a man posing as a ward boy. The accused, Amit Mullick, was apprehended after hospital CCTV footage aided police. Mullick claimed past employment at related hospitals, but records show no such staffer, raising further questions about his identity and motive.

title: Delhi toxic pollution: To walk or not in bad air? Morning guide answered
content: Doctors are warning against outdoor exercise during high pollution days, as breathing toxic air can be equivalent to smoking. Morning walks in haze expose lungs to harmful PM2.5 and PM10 particles, worsening respiratory and heart conditions. Indoor workouts are recommended as a safer alternative when air quality is poor.

title: Union Minister Bhupathiraju Srinivasa Varma emphasises speedy completion of railway projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: He assures Central Government‚Äôs support for the development of the Vijayawada Division and swift completion of all pending projects

title: Microsoft India MD urges students to embrace technology and leadership qualities
content: Rajiv Kumar highlights the role of AI and emerging technologies in shaping the global economy and stresses the importance of continuous learning, decision-making, and effective communication for students to tackle future challenges

title: Calcutta HC withdraws protection to BJP‚Äôs Suvendu Adhikari for registration of FIRs against him
content: The High Court also quashed 15 FIRs against the West Bengal LoP and directed officials to set up SITs in four other cases; earlier in December 2022, the Calcutta High Court had ruled that its permission was necessary before lodging an FIR against the Nandigram MLA

title: Andhra Pradesh prioritises forest conservation and eco-tourism initiatives
content: Forests are a national asset and their protection is a collective responsibility, says Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan; he also calls for effective steps to prevent human-wildlife conflicts

title: National Highway Protection Council demands government to resume road-widening works
content: Kerala High Court approve an affidavit by the Chief Secretary to resume the road widening works of the Neryamangalam-Valara stretch of the Kochi-Dhanushkodi National Highway

title: Gyan Bharatam Mission to sign MoUs with institutes for conservation of manuscripts
content: 20 institutues to ink deal with the Culture Ministry‚Äôs flagship initiative on Saturday, 30 more to follow later

title: PM SHRI signing a tactical decision: Minister
content: Sivankutty says government not ready to give up on funds for Samagra Shiksha and other projects.    The PM SHRI scheme will wind up by March 2027. By signing the MoU, the State will get the arrears due to Samagra Shiksha Kerala and two years of PM SHRI funds, which together come to ‚Çπ1,476.13 crore

title: 69 candidates receive appointment orders at Rozgar Mela in Vijayawada
content: Central government has provided employment to nearly 10 lakh youth through 17 editions of the Rozgar Mela, says Union Minister

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin inaugurates renovated Tholkappia Poonga
content: The park has been upgraded with additional amenities and features including a skywalk at a cost of ‚Çπ42.45 crore. It is now open to walkers and visitors on all days and will offer guided tours for the public and eco-tours for students

title: LDF government saffronising Kerala, says Youth Congress
content: Youth Congress challenges the SFI and the DYFI to protest against the State‚Äôs decision to sign the PM SHRI agreement with the Centre

title: Microsoft India chief lauds Naidu‚Äôs vision for Quantum Valley in Amaravati
content: Rajiv Kumar says AI is reshaping every sector and believes Chandrababu Naidu‚Äôs leadership will drive India‚Äôs next tech revolution through Quantum Technology

title: Kerala |¬†Meet Bindu V.V., the inquest photographer behind thousands of police investigations
content: Bindu was recently featured in artist K.R. Sunil‚Äôs book, ‚ÄòVelichappadum Pokkattadikkarum‚Äô, on the unsung lives of ordinary individuals

title: Dyke wall, surveillance road proposed along industrial stretch of Periyar
content: Survey completed for around 730 metres of the land identified for the project; IDRB finalised the design of the dyke wall, and a detailed project report to be prepared after completion of the survey work

title: Ghats will be developed along 4.7-kilometre stretch of river Godavari, says Collector
content: An estimated six crore devotees are expected to attend Godavari Pushkarams-2027; two lakh devotees likely to arrive by train and 25,000 by bus, says Keerthi Chekuri

title: Thrissur declared free from extreme poverty
content: A total of 5,013 families in Thrissur district have now been officially declared free from extreme poverty

title: Consider government service as platform to serve the underprivileged: V. Somanna
content: As part of the national Rozgar Mela initiative, 47 candidates received appointment orders for various positions in the Departments of Posts, Railways, the Airports Authority of India, and the Union Home Ministry

title: YSRCP alleges smear campaign against party leaders in illicit liquor scam
content: Party leaders led by Jogi Ramesh lodge complaint with Cyber Crime Division, accusing the ruling coalition of orchestrating the campaign through IVRS calls

title: Survivor pool strategy: Colts, Patriots among top options in Week 8
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 8, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

content: Manchester United are considering a January move for Atl√©tico Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: In Naga culture, Genna relates to restrictions for a national holiday or an important day for the community

title: First phase of Rajaji Nagar flats expected to be ready by December
content: A total of 32 families from Rajaji Nagar, who had given up their land and dwelling for the project, will get flats in the first phase.

title: Interstate drug syndicate kingpin arrested by Delhi Police
content: Zamjith alias Samjhu (38), a native of Kerala, was apprehended in Mangaluru on October 21; police say he was operating the syndicate from Thailand; three members of the syndicate were arrested by police in July

title: Sexual assault case prompts heightened security measures in Kazhakuttam
content: Preliminary assessments reveal that nearly 30% of hostels lack CCTV coverage and other basic security infrastructure.

title: DKS warns partymen to follow discipline; some MLAs seeks disciplinary action against Yathindra
content: Sources in the Congress said the party high command had collected information from the KPCC about Dr Yathindra‚Äôs public utterances on leadership

title: Chittoor court convicts five in 2015 Mayor couple murder case
content: XI Additional District and Sessions Court finds all five accused guilty in the killing of former Mayor Katari Anuradha and her husband Mohan; sentencing on October 27

title: PM Modi to lead parade on 150th birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
content: Unlike previous years, parade to be moving, not static; women to give guard of honour; parade to showcase India‚Äôs unity in diversity; contingent of BSF‚Äôs indigenous dogs will demonstrate skills

title: NC wins three Rajya Sabha seats in J&K; BJP victorious in one
content: Choudhary Mohammad Ramzan was declared the winner in the first seat and Sajad Kichloo in the second seat, the party said in a statement

title: Stalin reviews monsoon preparedness in Adyar estuary
content: In view of heavy rain received during the northeast monsoon, discharge from the Chembarambakkam reservoir into the Adyar has been increased to 945 cusecs

title: Heat stress may have played key role in Karur stampede, says study
content: The researchers estimated that the heat generated by the densely packed crowd was comparable to solar energy hitting the same ground area, intensifying heat accumulation.

title: Daily quota of transportation of paddy stepped up substantially, says TNCSC
content: The Tamil Nadu Civil Supplies Corporation (TNCSC) has significantly increased the daily quota for transporting paddy in Thanjavur district from 2,000 to 12,000 tonnes to address stockpiling concerns following a substantial harvest.

title: Govt. committed to bring in transparency in every sector: Pralhad Joshi
content: The Union Minister says there was no dearth of jobs for the present-day youth, but they had the responsibility of properly utilising the opportunities

title: ‚ÄòAnpu‚Äô campaign to mainstream persons with intellectual disability
content: It will create awareness in society about intellectual disability and make interventions to address the difficulties faced by those who have the condition

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Work begins on ‚ÄòAlappuzha- A Global Water Wonderland‚Äô project
content: The project, being implemented at a cost of ‚Çπ93.17 crore, aims to transform Alappuzha beach, canals, and backwaters into an iconic global tourist destination

title: Victims and perpetrators of terrorism cannot be equated: Jaishankar at event marking 80 years of UN
content: In his remarks, the External Affairs Minister said "all is not well" with the UN as its debates have become "increasingly polarised" and its working "visibly gridlocked"

title: Rainfall isn‚Äôt enough: scientists call for smarter groundwater management in Telangana
content: The study found that even with ample rainfall in two consecutive years, recharge levels were significantly lower in the second year; conversely, a drought year followed by favorable rainfall tends to result in increased recharge

title: Houseboat operations in Vembanad exceed sustainable limits by 200%, says CWRDM study
content: Study report says that unregulated system delivers short-term economic and tourist satisfaction benefits but results in severe environmental degradation. Also, most houseboats carry more than double their registered passenger capacity

title: Hassan woman dies as wall collapses during rains in Arakalgud taluk
content: The incident occurred when all the family members were sleeping. Her body has been shifted to Arakalgud for a post-mortem.

title: Study of Thevaram-inscribed copper plates unearthed from Sirkazhi temple begins
content: A total of 23 panchaloha idols of various deities and 483 copper plates bearing Thevaram hymns were unearthed a few feet below the surface near the west gopuram entrance of the temple during renovation works

title: ‚ÄòNellikkampoyil Night Riders‚Äô movie review: A horror comedy that‚Äôs neither funny nor scary
content: Neither does the blend of horror and comedy happen seamlessly, nor is the film successful in eliciting much laughter or creating effective horror

title: SWR expands ‚ÄòNamma Nakshe‚Äô digital navigation to 14 railway stations in Bengaluru Division
content: According to SWR, the web-based platform, accessible at www.nammanakshe.com, provides passengers with real-time, station-specific navigation assistance through an interactive digital map.

title: Bihar Assembly elections: Mahagathbandhan manifesto to prioritise law and order
content: Apart from highlighting the spurt in crime rate under NDA rule, the emphasis on law and order is likely to counter NDA‚Äôs 'jungle raj‚Äô barb under Lalu Prasad

title: Develop land proposed for Bidadi township as special mulberry zone to boost silk production: MP Dr. C.N. Manjunath
content: Participating in golden jubilee celebrations of Central Silk Board ‚Äì National Silkworm Seed Organisation, Dr. Manjunath said it is better to boost silk production in these areas than acquiring lands as farmers are getting monthly remunerative incomes from sericulture

title: PM Modi launches Bihar poll campaign with two rallies, says NDA will break all electoral records
content: PM Modi kicks off Bihar poll campaign with back-to-back rallies in Samastipur and Begusarai, endorsing CM Nitish Kumar and other alliance party leaders

title: India does not do trade deals in hurry or with gun to our head: Goyal
content: ‚ÄúI do not think India has ever decided who its friends will be based on any other considerations other than national interest,‚Äù said Piyush Goyal.

title: GST officials should rely on technology and not place extra burden on taxpayers: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Finance Minister also nudged Goods and Services Tax (GST) officers to make use of technology to reduce the compliance burden on taxpayer seeking GST registration

title: Mumbai advocate petitions NHRC over Deepavali pollution, carbide explosives, animal harm
content: The advocate urges national study and regulatory overhaul to protect life, health and environment during festivals ¬†

title: Why the showcase of Indian idols at The British Museum must spark debate on colonial loot
content: A glamorous fundraising gala, Pink Ball, was also held to coincide with the conclusion of the exhibition Ancient India: Living Traditions

title: Sale Of Air Purifiers Rises In Delhi As Air Quality Remains In 'Poor' Category
content: With the city's air quality remaining in the "poor" category, Delhiites are rushing to stock up on air purifiers and masks, leading to a 60-70 per cent jump in sales, traders said.

title: Man Caught With Stack Of 250 Voter ID Cards In Bengal, Detained
content: A man carrying around 250 voter ID cards was detained in Nadia district of Bengal, days before the Election Commission begins the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in the state.

title: Setback For Actor Mohanlal As Kerala High Court Says His Ivory Ownership Certificates Are Illegal
content: The Kerala High Court on Friday held that the Forest Department's ownership certificates for ivory items in the possession of actor Mohanlal were void and legally unenforceable.

title: Highway Body To Display Pass Details At Toll Plazas To Raise User Awareness
content: The National Highways Authority of India has directed its field offices to prominently display information regarding the availability of the Local Monthly Pass' and the Annual Pass' at all fee plazas to enhance transparency and raise user awareness

title: As Fire Spread In Andhra Bus Accident, Driver Fled, Didn't Help Others: Cops
content: The driver of the bus which caught fire in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool in the early hours of Friday had alighted to check on the situation but panicked and fled instead of helping passengers who were trapped, a senior police official has told NDTV.

title: US Conducts 10th Strike On Suspected Drug-Running Boat In Carribean, 6 Dead
content: The US military has conducted its 10th strike on a suspected drug-running boat, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Friday, blaming the Tren de Aragua gang for operating the vessel and leaving six people dead in the Caribbean.

title: Man Stabs Brother To Death, Then Kills Sister-In-Law In Front Of Her Children
content: A man stabbed his brother and his sister-in-law to death in front of their young children following a dispute over property in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Friday.

title: "All Is Not Well": S Jaishankar's Criticises UN, Pak Over Terror Response
content: India on Friday cited Pakistan's attempts to protect at the UN Security Council the terror outfit that claimed responsibility for the Pahalgam attack to point out that the global body's work has been "gridlocked" in the absence of urgent reforms.

title: Two Years Of War Leave Gaza Buried Under 61 Million Tonnes Of Debris
content: After two years of war, Gaza is buried under more than 61 million tonnes of debris and three quarters of buildings have been destroyed, according to UN data

title: Drones, Glide Bombs, Patriots: Inside The Arsenal Powering Ukraine War
content: Ukraine's allies are gathering in London on Friday with President Volodymyr Zelensky and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer pushing for more long-range missiles to be delivered to Kyiv.

title: Spanish Police Recovers Missing $700,000 Picasso Painting
content: Spanish police said Friday that a Pablo Picasso painting that vanished en route to an exhibition has been found, raising doubts if it was ever loaded onto a transport truck.

title: UP Man Beaten To Death By Drunk Relative, Accused Missing
content: A 52-year-old man was beaten to death with a stick allegedly by his intoxicated family member here, police said on Friday.

title: Tamil Nadu To Receive Rain As Cyclone Likely To Form Over Bay Of Bengal
content: A low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal is likely to intensify into a cyclonic storm by the morning of October 27, IMD said on Friday.

title: UP Woman Made To Abort Twice, Pressured To Sleep With In-Laws. All For A Son
content: In the desire for a baby boy, a woman in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur was made to abort her pregnancy twice and then forced to have relations with her father-in-law and brother-in-law.

title: Why Louvre Museum Heist Is A Classic Case Of German Efficiency
content: Photos of a German-made freight lift that the thieves used in a lightning-fast daylight heist at the Louvre have gone viral. And its manufacturer is now riding high from the unexpected endorsement.

title: Pope Leo Lifts Traditional Mass Restrictions In Bid To Heal Church Divisions
content: Pope Leo XIV has authorised a traditional mass to take place this weekend at the Vatican, lifting restrictions that angered conservatives in his latest attempt to heal splits within the Catholic Church.

title: How Mysterious Drone Flights Are Paralysing Europe's Busiest Airports
content: Mysterious drone flights over the airspace of European Union member countries in recent weeks have alarmed the public and elected officials.

title: PM Launches Bihar Campaign With 2 Rallies, Says NDA Will Break All Records
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched his Bihar assembly poll campaign with back-to-back rallies in Samastipur and Begusarai districts, asserting that the NDA under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar will break all previous electoral records.

title: Man, 60, Attacks Wife With Machete On A Busy Road In Karnataka
content: A man - wearing a cap, with a machete in one hand and a plastic tote in the other - goes about attacking his wife in the middle of a busy road in Vijayapura district of Karnataka, shows a disturbing video.

title: India Doesn't Do Trade Deals With "Gun To Our Head": Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said India does not do trade agreements in hurry or with a "gun to our head".

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: Justin Herbert, Kimani Vidal lead Chargers in commanding win over Vikings
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Minnesota Vikings 37-10 on friday night . they played their worst game of the season in a pummeling of Minnesota . the Charger's only win was a 29-27 victory over the lifeless 1-6 Miami Dolphins .

title: A well-done steak for Deion, medium for Dabo: How CFB chefs please everyone's palates
content: in 2019, he was the executive chef of the Seattle Seahawks . he had applied for a culinary position with LSU before where he would be working at Tiger Stadium . in his interview, he cooked for 35 people -- executives, dieticians and other high-ranking officials .

title: Trump ends trade talks with Canada ahead of Asia trip where confrontations loom
content: the move threatens to unravel testy economic ties between the u.s. and its northern neighbor . the move, triggered by a ad featuring audio from conservative icon Ronald Reagan criticizing protectionism, threatens a critical review of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement .

title: Jaylen Brown serves as pre-audition judge for Druski's 'Coulda Been Records' auditions
content: aspiring rapper "Blicky" made four appearances in the auditions . he also joked with a contestant who said she was there to support her brother . "coulda been love" is a keeper right the first time .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: Our guide to every Week 8 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Aaron Rodgers faces his former team when the Packers come to town . the Giants and Eagles face off in a classic NFC East showdown . we have a key stat to know and a betting nugget for each contest .

title: Week 9 preview: Conference title contenders, key matchups and more
content: a conference in the country has a clear-cut front-runner . there are 60 FBS schools with no more than one conference loss . it's not even just the sheer volume of contenders, but the surprising teams in the mix .

title: Rodgers plans to retire with Packers when done
content: Aaron Rodgers has said he's "pretty sure" this season with the Pittsburgh Steelers will be his last . he says he will retire a Packer and see what happens after that . "i've got a lot of love for the organization and my time there," he said .

title: Wetzel: Sports betting money is good, but it's not cheap
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: Will this season ever make sense? These 32 games could help start the process
content: the college football season has been good at shutting down fun upstart stories . it's been a good week for a college football team to declutter this season . if you're playing a Texas A&M team in Baton Rouge, you'll be able to get to the top of the polls .

title: Answering 22 questions on the Billups, Rozier arrests: What happens now?
content: former NBA player and coach damon Jones indicted in sports betting and rigged poker games . two separate cases involve current and former NBA players . prosecutors allege rigging poker games against high rollers after enticing them to play with former players including Jones and Billups .
